result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia L. Sullivan Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to make $100 payments beginning February 1, 2016 and on the 1st of every month thereafter until paid in full.
$200 for 2 chain saws and tool box. Restitution for trailcam to be determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia L. Sullivan Perry

defendant.name: Sullivan Perry, Patricia L.
defendant.address: 565 State Highway 17 South, Eagle River, WI 54521

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in court. Court questions defendant as to non-payment of . Defendant states needs time to pay balance. Review hearing scheduled 08-01-2016 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
From Defendant, having financial difficulites.  Could you extend out her first payment until 03/01/16.  Court will allow.

3:48 p.m. Defendant Patricia L. Sullivan Perry in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she met with DA Michlig - defendant wishes to proceed on own - waiver free and voluntary - Defendant wishes to enter Alford plea -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Off record for Court to review complaint - On record 3:56 pm. Victim impact statements filed. Bednar states defendant is charged with transferring stolen property - not theft. Bednar requests restitution. Court finds that strong evidence is in file to find defendant guilty. Defendant states she owned bicycle for over 12 years - was given to her by a client - does not wish to give names. Bednar/Defendant/Court  statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Fine - $579.00
Restitution - $200 for 2 chainsaws, toolbox 
Restitution for trailcam to be determined  - State to notify within 10 days
Appeal rights given
Defendant to make $100 payments beginning February 1, 2016.
Defendant not understanding charges because of restitution - Court re-explains charges to defendant and explains that defendant was not charged with breaking in and stealing property. Adj. 4:15 p.m.

3:22 p.m. Defendant Patricia L. Sullivan Perry in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not eligible for PD. Court questions defendant as to qualification for court appointed attorney - not eligible. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Patricia L. Sullivan Perry in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
